programme.desc: Crabbe agrees to cook for a reluctant witness in a police safe house, and comes under threat from both a ruthless villain and an unscrupulous copper. Meanwhile, Henderson is alarmed by an unwelcome reminder of a past indiscretion. Comedy drama, starring Richard Griffiths

programme.desc: London, 1944, and with husband Alec now in prison, Alison struggles with her toddler and young baby. Alec insists he's undercover gathering intelligence, and reassures her that his 'crime' was made up - but Alison has decided to leave him. As they're living in poverty, she takes the boys to Cumberland to stay with her mother. In the 1960s, Alison questions Father Timothy. Faced with conflicting explanations of Alec's past and a startling revelation about his work, she finds herself questioning everything she thought she knew. Drama, starring Ruth Wilson and Iain Glen

The band are unsettled when a table of racist Germans walks out during a performance at the Imperial Hotel's Christmas Lunch, but Stanley later engineers a fitting revenge. Lady Cremone hosts a New Year's Eve party on her estate and everybody is surprised when Julian turns up, announcing he has been in France exploring a new business idea

programme.title: Dancing on the Edge
programme.desc: The band plays at a dinner at the Imperial Hotel, during which Louis discovers that one of Julian's fellow Freemasons provided him with an alibi for the night Jessie was attacked. Masterson acquires Music Express magazine with Lady Cremone's assistance, and makes Stanley the editor-in-chief. Drama by Stephen Poliakoff, starring Chiwetel Ejiofor, Matthew Goode and John Goodman

However, his time is rapidly running out as the Criminal Investigations Bureau start probing his career, and in desperation he acquires a firearm under false pretences and absconds with his pregnant wife - can Meadows and Webb track them down before events reach a tragic conclusion?

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Chandler finally runs out of options and as a gunshot echoes around the station, Debbie is rushed into hospital in a desperate bid to save her unborn child. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: McAllister, still recuperating in hospital, vents her bitterness at Meadows, making it clear she blames him for Chandler's death, while Nixon puts her life on the line to prove her theory that Baxter is the serial killer

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The serial killer's last victim is found and Sun Hill celebrates as Baxter is finally put behind bars, but Nixon has serious doubts about whether they've got the right man. Meanwhile, guilt is preying on Taviner - especially now that Hollis knows who started the station fire - and a confrontation with a ruffian brings him to breaking point Hywel Bennett guest stars

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne receives an SOS from Holloway Prison, whose usual maternity workers have been struck down by illness, and when she and Trixie step in to help, the nun puts her reputation on the line to prevent a heavily pregnant convict having her unborn baby taken away by social services. Shelagh faces heartache when a routine pregnancy check reveals something far more serious, Alec has a confession for Jenny, and Fred takes the gang to the theatre to celebrate Chummy's birthday - only for the trip to end in disaster. Lacey Turner, best known as EastEnders' Stacey Branning, guest stars

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny has an eventful few days, starting with a patient who as well as having herself to worry about, is also struggling to cope with her mother, an agoraphobic who hasn't been outside for at least 12 years. On top of that, Alec asks the midwife to accompany him to Brighton for the weekend, leaving her wondering if his intentions are strictly honourable. However, things soon take a tragic turn. Meanwhile, Shelagh joins the local choir to take her mind off her problems. Jessica Raine, Leo Staar and Laura Main star

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Man Who Cried
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama about Abel Mason, an ordinary working man whose extramarital affair leads to murder, and prompts him to hit the road with his son in search of a new life. The pair head north and Abel eventually finds employment with a wealthy garage owner. Ciaran Hinds and Kate Buffery star

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: A film star arrives from America and throws a summer garden party for the entire village of St Mary Mead - where one of her fans drinks a poisoned cocktail and promptly drops dead. Fortunately, the guest list includes Miss Marple, who immediately sets about tracking down the killer. Feature-length drama, starring Joan Hickson, Claire Bloom and Barry Newman

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries
programme.desc: The sleuth's former French teacher, the landlord of an idyllic Scottish island, receives a death threat in response to her blocking its development as a health spa. As the inspector investigates, he soon uncovers a case of adultery and sexual jealousy in the picturesque surroundings. Patrick Malahide stars

programme.title: McMafia

Masha receives an ultimatum, and Joseph seeks an ally in his bid to help Lyudmilla

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: Reeling from the death of his friend, Luther races to save the others from Cornelius' terrible retribution. With Luther's increasing absence from the case, Halliday helms the hunt for a killer on the loose - a killer determined to complete his final macabre masterpiece. Thriller, starring Idris Elba

programme.title: Happy Valley
programme.desc: Nevison confides in Kevin about the kidnappers' ransom demands, making the accountant realise the enormity of the situation he has created. His boss now faces two problems - raising the money and telling his ill wife their daughter has been abducted. Catherine's search for Tommy gains momentum when she receives a tip-off regarding his whereabouts, much to the concern of Claire, who thought her sister had put all that in the past, and things are strained when Catherine's grandson Ryan makes an unwelcome appearance at a family dinner. programme.desc: Scotland v Italy (Kick-off 12.30pm). Gabby Logan presents all the action from the opening match in the final round of fixtures, held at BT Murrayfield. Burnley are managed by former City captain Vincent Kompany, who won this trophy twice while at the club. The Clarets have performed well under his stewardship and look set for an immediate return to the Premier League. programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Anita Rani meet volunteers doing conservation work on the River Wye, including creating a 30-acre wetland to harbour some of the river's most cherished wildlife. Adam Henson meets the farmer trying to do his bit to save the river, Tom Heap investigates why the Wye has been allowed to decline close to the point of being declared ecologically dead, and Adrian Chiles is in North Wales discovering what it takes to be a hill farmer

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: The wildlife of Britain's woodlands through the seasons, including a look at how the reintroduction of wild boar to the Forest of Dean has helped robins to find food in winter. Other creatures featured include the world's largest land slug and starlings falling prey to owls on Bodmin Moor. Plus, a look at how a subterranean network of fungi connects the whole forest together

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Clissold Park in Stoke Newington. Treasures include a collection of ancient Peruvian pottery, with some pieces made over a thousand years ago, an archive of textile designs by pioneering post-war designer Althea McNish, and Harold Wilson's pipe. Ceramics expert Serhat Ahmet challenges Fiona to work out what she should buy, sell or keep from a selection of figures by the Meissen factory

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Palmer pleads not guilty and convinces the jury of his innocence. He returns to Tenerife to run his timeshare empire, leaving his family behind. Cooper initially cooperates with the police but, after receiving a threat, he also pleads not guilty. Parry escapes to Spain but is tracked down and arrested. As the Task Force winds up, Boyce, Jennings and Brightwell make a shocking realisation - the criminals they caught only ever had half of the stolen gold

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad reviews the day's Premier League clash between Arsenal and Crystal Palace at Emirates Stadium. The title-challenging Gunners were looking to complete a double over Palace after prevailing 2-0 at Selhurst Park in August thanks to a strike by Gabriel Martinelli and a Marc Guehi own goal. Plus, a round up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: Jordan North is back on the island to catch up with the finalists about their island transformations, and the Warriors put the trainees through their paces in their last training sessions ahead of the final challenges. In the last Coach's challenge, the contestants struggle through an endurance hold in 30 degree heat, which leads to concerns that one of the trainees has pushed themselves too far. On the final day, the remaining finalists face the biggest challenge yet - Fighting Spirit

programme.title: Emma, Oti & Rylan's Big Red Nose Day Challenge
programme.desc: Emma Willis, Oti Mabuse and Rylan attempt to climb the Cairn Gorm mountain in the Scottish Highlands to raise money for Comic Relief. Starting from Braemar, the climbers receive a heroes' send off as they head away from the historic town and the toilet facilities. Their three-day expedition does not go as smoothly as they had hoped as 80mph winds threaten to end their journey before they barely get started

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Jon Kay and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: The amazing story of a brave officer and his dog injured by a man with a zombie knife, and an appeal for information on the tragic stabbing of a teenager

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A West Midlands police officer receives life-changing injuries when a man viciously bites his finger. Plus, cameras follow Leicestershire Fire & Rescue as they train at an airport

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore a former bank in Greater Manchester, a mid-terrace in the West Midlands and a three-bedroom semi-detached near Walsall

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles hosts the show from Norwich, and visits the museum at Norwich Castle to discover East Anglia's ancient mammals. With experts Raj Bisram and Stephanie Connell

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Sid finds out the truth about Damien, while Luca lashes out. Elsewhere, Scarlett's first VPAS shift fails to go to plan

programme.title: Jay and Dom's Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Dominic Chinea demonstrate DIY tips and tricks that will not break the bank and delve into the BBC archives for advice from the nation's favourite experts. They begin by creating free-standing shelves using scaffolding poles and an old set of drawers

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown helps a Buckinghamshire couple find a new home on the Isle of Wight, and also discovers why the island is an ideal location for growing dozens of varieties of tomatoes

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Philip Serrell embark on a trip around East Anglia, where purchases include a garden fountain and a homemade post box

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: An intrepid team of four friends competes for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Ronan Keating and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zack comes up with a plan to honour his and Whitney's lost child and Lexi gets frustrated with Emma on Mother's Day. Freddie treats Jean to a slap-up lunch at The Vic and Ravi flirts with Chelsea in an attempt to put pressure on Denise to gain access to Jack's files

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Single mother Amy is desperate to learn to drive to improve the lives of her kids. But after 13 years learning and two failed tests under the instruction of her own mother, both feel they are going backwards. During five days, they must try and stop Amy's panic attacks while driving

programme.title: The Gold: The Inside Story
programme.desc: The true story of Britain's biggest bullion heist, featuring the personal accounts of the police officers who investigated the 1983 robbery at the Brink's-Mat security depot. Speaking for the first time since the robbery, Detective Chief Superintendent Brian Boyce and DC Tony Yeoman reveal the challenges they faced, the strategy they took and the tragedy that unfolded as they staked out Kenneth Noye, one of the men at the epicentre of the gang transforming the gold into cash

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob joins director Stephen Frears on the Vienna set of forthcoming drama The Palace, and looks back his career while exploring the city. Frears looks back on his breakthrough in the theatre, at the Royal Court in London in the early 1960s, through BBC's Play for Today to his movie breakthrough with My Beautiful Laundrette and Dangerous Liaisons. With contributions from Hugh Grant, Judi Dench, Steve Coogan, Hanif Kureishi, Glenn Close, John Malkovich, Jack Black, Helen Mirren and Meryl Streep

programme.title: Philomena (2013)
programme.desc: A teenager in 1950s Ireland becomes pregnant, and is sent to a home for 'fallen women', while her baby is forcibly taken from her and sent to America to be adopted. Fifty years later, she meets a disillusioned political journalist who attempts to reunite her with her son. Fact-based drama, starring Judi Dench and Steve Coogan

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Anna Maxwell Martin hosts an extended edition of the satirical panel show, with Steph McGovern and Chris McCausland joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels help Chipmunk deliver his packages

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: As Peggee and the Hummingbirds journey up the river to deliver a parcel, they have fun spotting and avoiding the wildlife that they meet along the way

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer is left with a mountain of work when the farmer is rendered incapable

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Deep in the caverns below Beanotown town hall, a mysterious species of over-sized hamsters may or may not exist, so may or may not be at risk of being hunted down and turned into fluffy slippers

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: The kids get a chance to run Miss Skippy's new food kiosk, where Mouse starts serving his own 'perfect' chilli

programme.title: The Football Academy
programme.desc: After impressing in her own age group, U16s attacking midfielder Dream gets the chance to play up for the senior U18s team

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Goalkeeper and football fan Tristan had to take a break from playing with his local team due to illness. He wants a den to help him recover and to store his football memorabilia

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors investigate how lungs move, with the help of a huge water slide

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: The presenters kick-off Red Nose Day

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall experiences extremely cold conditions, and discovers how animals in the frozen corners of Earth survive in sub-zero temperatures

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall and his daring crew explore the elemental furies of fire, ice, water and wind by taking a look at some of the most deadly forces of nature on the planet

programme.title: Life in the Air
programme.desc: The series turns to animals that fly, including footage of half a million mother bats, an agile sparrowhawk raiding for food, and large beetles taking to the sky as part of their mating ritual. The programme also reveals how peregrine falcons are able to reach speeds of 200mph, and why an albatross's nose helps it to fly. Narrated by Suranne Jones

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef travels to the far west of Cornwall to meet a potter whose work captures the rugged beauty of her surroundings. Then to the far east, on the trail of the poet Charles Causley, who spent his life in the Cornish border town of Launceston. There, Rick meets another Cornish writer, Patrick Gale, who has written a book on Causley's life, and considers him this country's greatest Second World War poet. Rick also whips up his favourite seabass dish

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Presenters visit food festivals across the UK, beginning with Edith Bowman and Colin Murray at the Stranraer Oyster Festival, as celebrations mark the start of the native oyster season. They sail into Loch Ryan to Scotland's largest oyster bed to discover why they're so special. Chef Julie Lin discovers bargains in the World Food aisles, and gets the lowdown on low fat, semi-skimmed and full fat milk, while farmer Jim Smith gets stuck into some sticky sweets

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook
programme.desc: Mary Berry challenges the celebrity cooks to prepare the perfect breakfast for houseguests. Two of the contestants adopt a Mexican theme, pitting quesadillas against breakfast burritos, while another presents the judges with an edible crossword. Mary and fellow judges Angela Hartnett and Chris Bavin each select their favourite dish, but even this is no protection against being eliminated from the contest. Claudia Winkleman presents

programme.title: Doctor Zhivago (1965)
programme.desc: A married Russian physician falls in love with another woman, but as their passionate affair plays out against the raging backdrop of the First World War and the Bolshevik revolution, he is torn between his desires and his loyalty to his wife. David Lean's epic drama based on Boris Pasternak's novel, starring Omar Sharif, Julie Christie, Geraldine Chaplin, Rod Steiger, Alec Guinness, Ralph Richardson, Tom Courtenay and Klaus Kinski

programme.title: The Real Marigold on Tour
programme.desc: Paul Nicholas, Sheila Ferguson, Wayne Sleep and Jan Leeming embark on an adventure in the capital of Argentina, Buenos Aires, first paying a visit to a late night Tango event where they spend the night dancing with the locals. The following day, the group explore what the cultural capital of Argentina has on offer. Having duetted together in the past, Sheila and Paul book a Tango singing lesson, while Wayne and Jan enrol in a life drawing class. For their final night in Buenos Aires, Sheila and Paul find a venue where they can perform the Tango song they learned earlier in the week

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Thomas Plant and Catherine Southon value items at London Zoo in Regent's Park, while presenter Paul Martin visits the Victoria and Albert Museum in Kensington to examine its fascinating history and explore the architecture gallery

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Comedians Rufus Hound and Chris McCausland join antiques experts Margie Cooper and Ochuko Ojiri in Merseyside. There are lots of laughs and bags of buys, but will there be profits aplenty?

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: In Portrush, Co Antrim, the crew race to rescue a boy who has got into difficulties after jumping off rocks, and one of the crew volunteers enters the water to save him. On the Pembrokeshire coast, the lifeguard team at Whitesands Beach join forces with the St David lifeboat crew to rescue someone who has been found unconscious in the water

programme.title: Universe
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, Brian Cox asks how the universe came to be. Throughout the programme, he explores how cutting-edge space missions have revealed the origin of the universe, how discoveries have helped scientists understand how we came to be here and the technology they have used along the way, from NASA's Hubble Space Telescope to the European Space Agency's Planck space telescope

programme.title: Chaka Khan at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of appearance by the American singer on the BBC over the course of five decades, featuring her number one hit I Feel For You, as well as I'm Every Woman, and Ain't Nobody in partnership with Rufus

programme.title: Aretha Franklin: Duets
programme.desc: Admirers including Elton John, Gloria Estefan, Smokey Robinson, PM Dawn, Bonnie Raitt and Rod Stewart share a stage with the Queen of Soul. The concert took place at Manhattan's Nederlander Theatre in 1993, as an AIDS benefit. Elton, Smokey and Rod provide backing vocals on the first number Chain of Fools

programme.title: Randy Crawford at Drury Lane
programme.desc: A 1981 concert at the Theatre Royal in London's West End by the American jazz and R&B singer, whose hits include One Day I'll Fly Away and You Might Need Somebody

programme.title: Queens of Soul
programme.desc: A compilation of archive footage to celebrate the critically-acclaimed female singers whose voices have come to define the soul genre, including Aretha Franklin, Roberta Flack, Gladys Knight, Randy Crawford, Angie Stone, Mary J Blige and Beyonce

programme.title: Northern Soul (2014)
programme.desc: A teenager living in a Northern town in the 1970s finds his horizons expanded when he discovers American soul music. He develops an inseparable friendship with a fellow devotee and the pair hope to achieve a brighter future beyond their bleak daily life. Drama, starring Elliot James Langridge, Josh Whitehouse, Steve Coogan and Ricky Tomlinson

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: When basketball legend Kareem Abdul-Jabbar finds out that Lil Dicky made a song about him, Dave gets a chance to meet his hero

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Gata has a night out, and Dave and Elz's friendship is tested when they perform together at a bar mitzvah. Comedy, starring Dave Burd and Travis Bennett

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: An exclusive online dating app leads to Dave being matched with pop star Doja Cat, and technological courtship ensues as he gets caught up in the excitement of a modern-day romance

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don and the team are back with a celebration of spring. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, the host will be planting clematis and rocket, cutting back grasses and making a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer. Plus, Carol Klein visits Colesbourne Gardens in Gloucestershire to revel in their vibrant displays of spring colour

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith discovers how cuts are affecting management of Dartmoor. She finds out how the major political parties are taking sides over to the right to camp debate, and catches up with author Guy Shrubsole to discover a rare rainforest in the UK. Matt Baker helps conservationists with a bird survey, Adam Henson visits an equine rehab centre, and Paralympian Sammi Kinghorn meets volunteers opening up Dartmoor for everyone. Plus, in the second of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles discovers what it takes to be a hill farmer in Wales

programme.title: Pilgrimage
programme.desc: Seven well-known personalities with differing faiths and beliefs put on their backpacks and waterproofs and set out on foot, by road and sea, travelling over 1,600km to learn about a key figure in early British Christianity - St Columba. Following ancient paths and heritage walking trails are interior designer Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen - a non-conforming pagan; England cricketing legend Monty Panesar - a practising Sikh; actor Louisa Clein, who is Jewish; TV personality Nick Hewer - an agnostic; social media influencer Scarlett Moffatt - a Christian; comedian Shazia Mirza - a Muslim; and Paralympian Will Bayley - a lapsed Christian

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef visits the fishing port of Boscastle and finds a seafood restaurant in a building which once housed rockets used to fire safety ropes out to sinking ships. A trip to Cornwall's only dedicated organic mushroom farm inspires him to cook a stir fry with 'lion's mane' mushrooms, which it is said can regrow your neurons. Rick also discovers a reason so many Germans love Cornwall

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores Abergavenny food festival in Wales, where he discovers the secrets of barbecuing success from experts Sam and Shauna. Farmer Meinir Howells gets a workout harvesting cockles with fifth-generation pickers in Carmarthenshire and Onkar Singh Purewal, a father of toddler triplets, is on the hunt for healthy food the whole family will eat

programme.title: The Cruel Sea (1953)
programme.desc: The veteran commander of a British escort vessel guides his inexperienced crew through the dangers of combat at sea during the Second World War Atlantic campaigns. Demoralised by the failure of his last command, the captain faces a life-or-death decision in his duty to sink an enemy vessel. Nautical action adventure, starring Jack Hawkins, Donald Sinden, Stanley Baker and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: Brief Encounter (1945)
programme.desc: A suburban housewife meets a married doctor by chance in a railway station waiting room. Later, their paths cross many times until the pair become friends and their meetings a fixed arrangement. But as their feelings for each other transform from friendship into passion, both come to realise the affair is doomed to fail. David Lean's romantic drama, starring Celia Johnson and Trevor Howard

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals the life of the hippopotamus as never seen before. The programme gets closer than ever to an animal that cannot swim yet is utterly dependent on water. In Botswana's Okavango delta, hippos face an unparalleled challenge - deep floodwaters dry to dust in a matter of months. In one extraordinary season, cameras go beneath the surface to see them protect their families and face enemies as they deal with the drought. Going far beyond their dangerous reputation, the programme discovers the true nature of the hippo, an animal that is compassionate, sensitive and highly intelligent

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The teams make over different classrooms of a children's nursery in Oxfordshire - one for babies, one for toddlers and another for three to five-year-olds. Each room must feature different areas to accommodate various activities and safety is the key, and while dominates most of their plans, one team controversially opts for a shade of beige. What will Michele Ogundehin and guest judge Sophie Robinson think of the end results?

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Elizabeth Talbot and Nick Davies examine the best antiques at Milestones Museum in Basingstoke, and Paul Martin finds out about the history of Southampton's cruise liners

programme.title: Six Nations Highlights
programme.desc: Ugo Monye presents action from the fifth and final round of fixtures, featuring Ireland v England at Aviva Stadium, France v Wales at Stade de France and Scotland v Italy at BT Murrayfield

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti work at London's Shangri-La Hotel, Britain's highest hostelry. Their expectations of a standard business guest experience are blown away by discovering a hotel that makes guests' personal moments special. From bath butlers to marriage proposals, the place is a resort for celebrations in the clouds

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Warship
programme.desc: Aircraft carrier HMS Queen Elizabeth sets out on its first transatlantic crossing, a four-month deployment on the high seas which has the primary purpose of putting the top secret F-35B Lightning Stealth Fighter to the test. Within hours of leaving Portsmouth, the vessel encounters a Russian warship and needs to take immediate evasive action, and the crew has to deal with floods and dangerous fuel leaks on their way to Florida

programme.title: We Need to Talk About Cosby
programme.desc: W Kamau Bell's documentary reveals how after Bill Cosby struck gold with The Cosby Show, a genre-defining family sitcom and monument to black excellence, he began leveraging his growing power inside the entertainment industry

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the comedy panel quiz the theme of tips and tools, with guests Joe Lycett, Holly Walsh and Bill Bailey joining regular Alan Davies

programme.title: The Hurt Locker (2008)
programme.desc: Two American bomb disposal experts operating in Iraq are assigned a new leader after their previous one dies in action. However, the sergeant's reckless attitude and love of battle consistently puts them at risk. Kathryn Bigelow's Oscar-winning drama, starring Jeremy Renner, Anthony Mackie, Guy Pearce and Ralph Fiennes

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Emma reminisces about the early days of her and Dave's friendship, during which they both worked at an advertising agency. Dave competes in a TV rap showcase

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce chairs the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Warrington, Cheshire, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey and the team help the Clark family declutter as they lay out their belongings in a warehouse only to discover they own 521 odd socks, 75 barbies and 28 games controllers. After moving from the US to a much smaller house in the UK the family no longer have the space they need. Carpenter Rob creates some floor to ceiling storage for the family while Dilly reorganises the kitchen and laundry area

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig explores the Lake District in a spiritual journey inspired by the work of poet William Wordsworth, beginning with a visit to a holy shrine only accessible at low tide

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Philip Serrell continue seeking items of value, on a tour of East Ayrshire and Dumfries and Galloway. Natasha picks up a silver tea caddy and a first edition Virginia Woolf collection of books. Philip discovers just why collecting ancient musical instruments was a status symbol in the 19th century. He also finds a beautiful watercolour by a local artist, but is distracted by some very tasty looking homemade scones

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef champions the food, history and culture of the county, foraging for mussels in his favourite rock pools, and touring Bodmin Moor's dark past with his son Jack. He also cooks a fool-proof souffle with artisan Cornish goat's cheese

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: Derek Brockway fires the starting cannon at the Beaumaris Regatta on Anglesey, then embarks on a 14-mile walk initially taking him into the town's heavily fortified castle before heading onto the Welsh Coast Path. Derek visits the hamlet of Penmon, before heading to the photogenic Black Nose lighthouse with views over Puffin Island. The walk turns inland for a couple of miles before arriving at a new stretch of path, which has been moved much closer to the headland with fine sea views. Derek's eventual destination is Red Wharf Bay, a wide sandy bay on the east coast of the island

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win ¬£10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the popularity of sugar-rich foods in Britain, and try to make their own versions of their favourite childhood sweets. The duo also prepare a cheesecake and a sweet-and-sour dish

programme.title: Eat Well for Less?
programme.desc: Glasgow couple Karen and Andy Stirrat have triplets, one of who is trialling a new chemotherapy drug while fighting an aggressive brain tumour. With so many hospital visits it's understandable that cooking and eating routines have fallen by the wayside. The pair tend to rely on ready meals and quick fixes, meaning lots of the food that Karen intended to cook ends up in the bin. Chris Bavin and Jordan Banjo want to get the family cooking more from scratch, so offer quick-and-easy recipe ideas. Plus, Jordan tries to boost Andy's confidence in the kitchen and Chris looks at how 21st-century tech might be able to help reduce waste

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Award-winning architect Piers Taylor and actress and property enthusiast Caroline Quentin explore extraordinary homes around the world. In the opening episode, the pair travel to Portugal, where they come across four very different properties. First, they visit a ultramodern house located in the Portuguese Riviera, before travelling to Penela, to view a property owned by British ex-pats Neil and Shirley. The pair then visit a house built within a pine forest near the Atlantic coast, before ending their trip at a property hidden in the mountainous region of Peneda-Geres National Park

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Raj Bisram value some Spiritualist photographs and a Hornby train set at Culzean Castle, while Paul Martin follows in the footsteps of Robert Burns

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, Jodie Kidd, Jamali Maddix and Suzi Perry go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman check out the food and festivities on offer at Belfast's Mela Festival, from Korean kimchi and Jamaican patties, to cockles and sticky toffee pudding. Later, farmer Jim Smith raises a glass to non-alcoholic beer, wine and spirits

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox is joined by comedians Alan Davies and Ivo Graham and actresses Samantha Bond and Sunetra Sarker, who champion their favourite books. The guests also review this week's two book club choices, which are The Space Between Us by Doug Johnstone and Lullaby by Leila Slimani

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: A volunteer in Scotland has to rescue his own father, whose fishing boat is drifting powerless towards a rocky shoreline. In Bristol, a father and son are among the crew that comes to the aid of two five-year-old girls who have drifted into the Bristol Channel on an inflatable, while in Ilfracombe, lifeboat volunteers race against time to save a mother and her daughter stranded at the base of huge sea cliffs

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts the second semi-final of the quiz, with four returning contenders answering questions on the specialist subjects of the Norman Conquest, Borussia Dortmund, popes of the Renaissance, and the film musicals of Alan Menken, before facing the general knowledge round

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the fourth of the quarter-finals, two teams of four students compete to make it to the next stage of the competition as they try to win two matches and progress to the semi-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace goes behind the scenes at a factory in Scarborough, North Yorkshire, where London's famous red double-decker buses are built, finding out what goes into making the electric model. Cherry Healey visits a factory where she gets to grips with the construction of tough laminated heated windscreens for buses, while historian Ruth Goodman learns about London's earliest double deckers and the vital role they played in the First World War

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: After recent revelations, Lance, Andy, Becky and Sophie are trying to come to terms with an uncertain future. Terry puts his emergency plan into action - but it will help only one of them. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook and Toby Jones

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Holy Land and Us: Our Untold Stories
programme.desc: Two-part documentary in which co-presenters Rob Rinder and Sarah Agha, along with others of Jewish and Palestinian heritage, explore how their families' histories were impacted by the founding of the state of Israel in 1948. They begin by meeting a father and son who follow in the footsteps of their ancestor, who became caught up in Israel's War of Independence, and a woman whose grandmother survived one of the most notorious episodes of the Nakba

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith discovers how cuts are affecting management of Dartmoor. She finds out how the major political parties are taking sides over to the right to camp debate, and catches up with author Guy Shrubsole to discover a rare rainforest in the UK. Matt Baker helps conservationists with a bird survey, Adam Henson visits an equine rehab centre, and Paralympian Sammi Kinghorn meets volunteers opening up Dartmoor for everyone. Plus, in the second of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles discovers what it takes to be a hill farmer in Wales

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: A plastic-free soap brand hopes to clean up with potential investors Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. Plus, the entrepreneurs behind mouldable fixing sticks claim they have found an alternative to glue, a 15-year-old enters the Den to help pitch a football board game and a micro-campervan business drives a hard bargain. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Glassblower Alison from Buckinghamshire and upcycling couple Fernando and Saurabh from Berkshire visit Dom Chinea's life-changing training camp. Alison aspires to sell her pieces in high-end galleries, but mentor Allister knows standards are high and getting her work into them won't be easy. He focuses on the details of Alison's pieces and pushes her hard to improve them. Fernando and Saurabh want to turn their upcycling hobby into a full-time business. Mentor Joel gives them tough feedback about concentrating on every aspect of their work and the importance of a good website

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Michael Palin: The Art of Travel
programme.desc: The actor looks back at a century-old rail service to St Andrews, where the LNER's publicity promoted an industrial service alongside familiar holiday resorts. From 1989

programme.title: Michael Palin's Hemingway Adventure
programme.desc: Travel series with the former Monty Python star, this time following in the footsteps of one of his favourite writers, Ernest Hemingway, retracing his journeys across Europe, Africa and America. Michael begins his odyssey in Spain, where he explores bullfighting in Valencia, before heading for Africa to see the spectacular Mount Kilimanjaro

programme.title: Michael Palin: Travels of a Lifetime
programme.desc: Michael Palin revisits his travel series, beginning with Around the World in 80 Days. He draws on his personal archive of audio recordings and diary notebooks, and reflects on how he became a seasoned global traveller. The first episode revisits his visits to Venice, Cairo, Saudi Arabia, India, Hong Kong and China - a nation that was closed to most westerners at the time. Featuring contributions from fans and friends including David Attenborough, Joanna Lumley and Simon Reeve

programme.title: Paris Police 1905
programme.desc: Armed with information provided by Dr Socquet, Cochefert makes an eventful visit to Dr Verlot. L√©pine asks his daughter to invite L'abb√© Gardey to supper to provide moral support, and Jouin and Fiersi join forces to break into the Ch√¢teau de Bagatelle. In French

programme.title: As Time Goes By

programme.title: Clive James: Postcard from Miami
programme.desc: Clive sets out to discover the truth about an American city that was seen as the vice capital of America, teeming with money, illegal aliens and cocaine. He investigates what is beneath the surface, meeting famous resdients in Miami Vice star Don Johnson and singer Gloria Estefan

programme.title: Paris Police 1905

programme.title: Bent Coppers: Crossing the Line of Duty
programme.desc: The final instalment reveals how, in the late 1970s, corruption within the City of London's CID had grown out of control - and how Operation Countryman was launched in response

programme.title: Come Dancing
programme.desc: Terry Wogan presents the 1977 final of the amateur dance contest, between North West and Midlands and West at the Lyceum Ballroom, London. Barri Haynes provides the commentary

programme.title: Inside Classical
programme.desc: Georgia Mann presents an evening of music from the Barbican in London, featuring the BBC Symphony Orchestra and guest principal conductor Dalia Stasevska. The orchestra begin with Elgar's Cello Concerto, performed by multi-award-winning Argentine cellist Sol Gabetta, and the evening culminates with Sibelius's First Symphony. In between is A Party with Auntie, a piece by Iain Farrington to celebrate the BBC's 100th anniversary, and featuring no less than 15 BBC theme tunes hidden within Iain's own melody

programme.title: Wayne Shorter at the London Jazz Festival
programme.desc: The American jazz saxophonist and composer, who died on March 2, captured in performance at the London Jazz Festival

programme.title: Britain's Most Fragile Treasure
programme.desc: Janina Ramirez explores the complex history of York Minster's Great East Window, the largest medieval stained-glass window in England. Composed of 311 panels, it was originally designed to tell the complete biblical history of the world from creation to the Last Judgement, and has been compared to Michelangelo's work at the Sistine Chapel. The historian closely examines the handiwork of its creator John Thornton, revealing intricate details that would not normally be visible, and follows a project to restore the window to its original glory

programme.title: Clive James: Postcard from Chicago
programme.desc: The writer visits the Windy City and finds there is a lot more to Chicago than memories of Al Capone and the St Valentine's Day Massacre. The people are surprisingly forthright about the problems of living in a city where millions of dollars change hands at the board of trade, but little is done to solve the problems of gang violence in the housing projects where shootings are a daily event

programme.title: Victorian Sensations
programme.desc: In the final episode, psychotherapist Philippa Perry explores ghosts, science and early cinema in the 1890s, and how the late Victorian passion for science co-exists with a deeply held belief in the paranormal

programme.title: Sold! Inside the World's Biggest Auction House
programme.desc: First of a two-part documentary going behind the scenes at Christie's to chart a year in the life of the international institution, recording the highs and lows of life in the art business, from London to Dubai, via Hong Kong and New York

programme.title: Britain's Most Fragile Treasure
programme.desc: Janina Ramirez explores the complex history of York Minster's Great East Window, the largest medieval stained-glass window in England. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's exploration of the West Country continues in south Devon. He arrives in Paignton to investigate an extraordinarily high murder rate in the literature of the 1930s. The Dartmouth Steam Railway conveys him in style to the beautiful home of Agatha Christie, in the company of her great-grandson, James Prichard

programme.title: The Flying Archaeologist
programme.desc: Ben Robinson flies over Wiltshire to uncover new discoveries in the Stone Age landscape of Stonehenge. Sites found from the air have led to exciting evidence that helps to explain why the monument's location was chosen and reveals at what point in history it was inhabited

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc: Richard Miles concludes his series charting the history of archaeological breakthroughs by discovering more about the ancient common man. The investigation takes the archaeologist from the elaborate grave of Egyptian boy king Tutankhamun to the Danish resting place of the Tollund Man, who died as part of an Iron Age sacrifice more than 2,000 years ago

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Art experts Jacky Klein and Dr Bendor Grosvenor visit museums as they track down previously unknown paintings by some of the world's greatest artists. In the first edition, the pair head to a museum store in Swansea, where they reveal a multi-million pound lost masterpiece with the potential to rewrite art history. Plus, Jacky is prompted to re-examine the life of renowned Polish artist Josef Herman, who created a giant painting of local coal miners

programme.title: The Rise of the Murdoch Dynasty
programme.desc: A huge scandal threatens Rupert's dream of passing on the family business to one of his children, resulting in 'the most humble day' of his life. In response to the revelations, the Murdoch Empire goes on the offensive and the alliance against him come under sustained pressure, but whistle-blowers begin to emerge, then a bombshell revelation completely changes public opinion. A sequence of disastrous events leaves Murdoch's business plans in ruins, and he closes the News of the World newspaper

programme.title: Sword, Musket & Machine Gun: Britain's Armed History

programme.title: Teletubbies

programme.title: The Toddler Club
programme.desc: Nigel, Bailee Bear and Benjee Bair welcome toddlers Romy, Eleanor, Musa, Yahya and Arabella, and their grown-ups to the Toddler Club. The What's in the Box? game reveals a colourful paint palette, and when the toddlers and parents open up a bigger box, they discover lots more objects and toys that are all to do with painting. This theme is explored through exploration, play, song and story. Grown-ups are encouraged to take part at home by hiding a safe, toddler-appropriate painting object inside a recycled box for them to reveal and explore with their toddler. Storytime is all about discovering new words, as Benjee and Bailee Bear discover what happens when they mix different paint colours together. programme.title: What's On Your Head?

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Italy (Kick-off 12.30pm). Gabby Logan presents all the action from the opening match in the final round of fixtures, held at BT Murrayfield. Scotland recorded a 33-22 victory when the sides met in Rome last year and have enjoyed some encouraging results this time around, though defeats to France and Ireland mean they no longer have a chance of winning the title. Italy have been competitive in all their matches so far, but are still without a win. With analysis from Martin Johnson and John Barclay, and commentary by Andrew Cotter, Sam Warburton and Chris Paterson

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Burnley (Kick-off 5.45pm). All the action from the sixth-round tie at Etihad Stadium. Burnley are managed by former City captain Vincent Kompany, who won this trophy twice while at the club. The Clarets have performed well under his stewardship and look set for an immediate return to the Premier League. However, they face the toughest of tests against the cup favourites, who tend to be particularly ruthless against lower league opposition, as shown in their 3-0 win away to Bristol City in the previous round. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Micah Richards

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. programme.title: Casualty

programme.title: Not Going Out

Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Chelsea v Everton at Stamford Bridge and Southampton v Tottenham Hotspur at St Mary's Stadium. Chelsea and the Toffees have both endured seasons to forget so far and will have been looking to get back on track with three points. Meanwhile, Spurs continued their bid to finish in the top four when they took on the relegation-threatened Saints. Plus, Aston Villa v Bournemouth, Brentford v Leicester City and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Leeds United

programme.title: Halloween (2018)
programme.desc: Four decades ago, Michael Myers terrorised the town of Haddonfield, Illinois and went on a killing spree, 15 years after murdering his sister. After a prison bus crashes, the killer is back in the wild, but survivor Laurie Strode is ready for his return. Director David Gordon Green's horror sequel based on John Carpenter's much imitated 1978 namesake movie. With Jamie Lee Curtis, returning to the franchise for the first time since 2002's Halloween Resurrection, Judy Greer and Andi Matichak

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles is joined in York by experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt. The reds and blues have the choice of two antique centres from which to buy three items

programme.title: Food Fest Wales
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher finds tips and treats among the food producers in Cardiff Market, from making Indian street food to baking vegan cakes that taste the same as conventional ones. Also, farmer Meinir Howells goes underground to reveal the secrets of cheese production in Harlech, and investigates the growing popularity of keeping chickens. Onkar Singh Purewal discovers the surprising array of food being produced in city centre community gardens

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: A profile of Delyth Prothero, Wales's most successful athletics manager, through the eyes of some Welsh greats including Colin Jackson, Iwan Thomas, Jamie Baulch and Matt Elias

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Claire McCollum is in Londonderry, Northern Ireland, to celebrate Mothering Sunday, meeting remarkable women who are inspiring the next generation through their faith and devotion

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Grimsby Town (Kick-off 2.15pm). All the action from the sixth-round tie at Amex Stadium. Brighton have enjoyed a strong season so far in league and cup, and are now expected to reach the Wembley semi-finals. However, they cannot afford to rest on their laurels against the League Two outfit, who have already upset one Premier League outfit in Southampton, prevailing 2-1 away from home in the previous round. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores British woodland, grassland, freshwater and ocean habitats, revealing the surprising and dramatic wildlife that exist right on the doorstep, the existence of which is critical for the survival of species right across the globe. The first episode examines the benefits of Britain's natural geology and examines ways in which depleted islands can be restored for future generations

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Anita Rani meet volunteers doing conservation work on the River Wye, including creating a 30-acre wetland to harbour some of the river's most cherished wildlife. Adam Henson meets the farmer trying to do his bit to save the river, Tom Heap investigates why the Wye has been allowed to decline close to the point of being declared ecologically dead, and Adrian Chiles is in North Wales discovering what it takes to be a hill farmer

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: The wildlife of Britain's woodlands through the seasons, including a look at how the reintroduction of wild boar to the Forest of Dean has helped robins to find food in winter. Other creatures featured include the world's largest land slug and starlings falling prey to owls on Bodmin Moor. Plus, a look at how a subterranean network of fungi connects the whole forest together

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Clissold Park in Stoke Newington. Treasures include a collection of ancient Peruvian pottery, with some pieces made over a thousand years ago, an archive of textile designs by pioneering post-war designer Althea McNish, and Harold Wilson's pipe. Ceramics expert Serhat Ahmet challenges Fiona to work out what she should buy, sell or keep from a selection of figures by the Meissen factory

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Palmer pleads not guilty and convinces the jury of his innocence. He returns to Tenerife to run his timeshare empire, leaving his family behind. Cooper initially cooperates with the police but, after receiving a threat, he also pleads not guilty. Parry escapes to Spain but is tracked down and arrested. As the Task Force winds up, Boyce, Jennings and Brightwell make a shocking realisation - the criminals they caught only ever had half of the stolen gold

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad reviews the day's Premier League clash between Arsenal and Crystal Palace at Emirates Stadium. The title-challenging Gunners were looking to complete a double over Palace after prevailing 2-0 at Selhurst Park in August thanks to a strike by Gabriel Martinelli and a Marc Guehi own goal. Plus, a round up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: Jordan North is back on the island to catch up with the finalists about their island transformations, and the Warriors put the trainees through their paces in their last training sessions ahead of the final challenges. In the last Coach's challenge, the contestants struggle through an endurance hold in 30 degree heat, which leads to concerns that one of the trainees has pushed themselves too far. On the final day, the remaining finalists face the biggest challenge yet - Fighting Spirit

programme.title: Emma, Oti & Rylan's Big Red Nose Day Challenge
programme.desc: Emma Willis, Oti Mabuse and Rylan attempt to climb the Cairn Gorm mountain in the Scottish Highlands to raise money for Comic Relief. Starting from Braemar, the climbers receive a heroes' send off as they head away from the historic town and the toilet facilities. Their three-day expedition does not go as smoothly as they had hoped as 80mph winds threaten to end their journey before they barely get started

programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: The amazing story of a brave officer and his dog injured by a man with a zombie knife, and an appeal for information on the tragic stabbing of a teenager

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A West Midlands police officer receives life-changing injuries when a man viciously bites his finger. Plus, cameras follow Leicestershire Fire & Rescue as they train at an airport

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore a former bank in Greater Manchester, a mid-terrace in the West Midlands and a three-bedroom semi-detached near Walsall

programme.desc: Eric Knowles hosts the show from Norwich, and visits the museum at Norwich Castle to discover East Anglia's ancient mammals. With experts Raj Bisram and Stephanie Connell

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Sid finds out the truth about Damien, while Luca lashes out. Elsewhere, Scarlett's first VPAS shift fails to go to plan

programme.title: Jay and Dom's Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Dominic Chinea demonstrate DIY tips and tricks that will not break the bank and delve into the BBC archives for advice from the nation's favourite experts. They begin by creating free-standing shelves using scaffolding poles and an old set of drawers

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown helps a Buckinghamshire couple find a new home on the Isle of Wight, and also discovers why the island is an ideal location for growing dozens of varieties of tomatoes

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Philip Serrell embark on a trip around East Anglia, where purchases include a garden fountain and a homemade post box

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: An intrepid team of four friends competes for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.desc: Ronan Keating and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zack comes up with a plan to honour his and Whitney's lost child and Lexi gets frustrated with Emma on Mother's Day. Freddie treats Jean to a slap-up lunch at The Vic and Ravi flirts with Chelsea in an attempt to put pressure on Denise to gain access to Jack's files

programme.title: X-Ray
programme.desc: The team is in Llandovery, with an investigation into a children's charity and a look at the craze for cakes that look like everyday objects

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Single mother Amy is desperate to learn to drive to improve the lives of her kids. But after 13 years learning and two failed tests under the instruction of her own mother, both feel they are going backwards. During five days, they must try and stop Amy's panic attacks while driving

programme.title: The Gold: The Inside Story
programme.desc: The true story of Britain's biggest bullion heist, featuring the personal accounts of the police officers who investigated the 1983 robbery at the Brink's-Mat security depot. Speaking for the first time since the robbery, Detective Chief Superintendent Brian Boyce and DC Tony Yeoman reveal the challenges they faced, the strategy they took and the tragedy that unfolded as they staked out Kenneth Noye, one of the men at the epicentre of the gang transforming the gold into cash

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob joins director Stephen Frears on the Vienna set of forthcoming drama The Palace, and looks back his career while exploring the city. Frears looks back on his breakthrough in the theatre, at the Royal Court in London in the early 1960s, through BBC's Play for Today to his movie breakthrough with My Beautiful Laundrette and Dangerous Liaisons. With contributions from Hugh Grant, Judi Dench, Steve Coogan, Hanif Kureishi, Glenn Close, John Malkovich, Jack Black, Helen Mirren and Meryl Streep

programme.title: Philomena (2013)
programme.desc: A teenager in 1950s Ireland becomes pregnant, and is sent to a home for 'fallen women', while her baby is forcibly taken from her and sent to America to be adopted. Fifty years later, she meets a disillusioned political journalist who attempts to reunite her with her son. Fact-based drama, starring Judi Dench and Steve Coogan

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Chelsea v Everton at Stamford Bridge and Southampton v Tottenham Hotspur at St Mary's Stadium. Chelsea and the Toffees have both endured seasons to forget so far and will have been looking to get back on track with three points. Meanwhile, Spurs continued their bid to finish in the top four when they took on the relegation-threatened Saints. Plus, Aston Villa v Bournemouth, Brentford v Leicester City and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Leeds United

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Action from the latest fixtures, including Motherwell v Rangers at Fir Park, Celtic v Hibernian at Celtic Park and Aberdeen v Hearts at Pittodrie

programme.title: Halloween (2018)
programme.desc: Four decades ago, Michael Myers terrorised the town of Haddonfield, Illinois and went on a killing spree, 15 years after murdering his sister. After a prison bus crashes, the killer is back in the wild, but survivor Laurie Strode is ready for his return. Director David Gordon Green's horror sequel based on John Carpenter's much imitated 1978 namesake movie. With Jamie Lee Curtis, returning to the franchise for the first time since 2002's Halloween Resurrection, Judy Greer and Andi Matichak

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Chelsea v Everton at Stamford Bridge and Southampton v Tottenham Hotspur at St Mary's Stadium. programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: The Sunday Show
programme.desc: Martin Geissler presents the main issues from the world of politics and beyond, featuring interviews, discussion and analysis on the stories that matter to Scotland

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton discuss the budget, and calls from religious leaders for higher taxes on the wealthiest elements of society to fix the cost of living crisis

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A Victorian farmhouse in Stenson Fields in Derby is converted into a 'forever' family home, while developers also transform houses in Beckenham in south London, and Carlisle

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Kate Bliss help the teams in Stamford, Lincolnshire, and Natasha Raskin Sharp visits Burghley House to look at The Hell Staircase, a fine Baroque mural

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Claire McCollum is in Londonderry, Northern Ireland, to celebrate Mothering Sunday, meeting remarkable women who are inspiring the next generation through their faith and devotion

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Grimsby Town (Kick-off 2.15pm). All the action from the sixth-round tie at Amex Stadium. Brighton have enjoyed a strong season so far in league and cup, and are now expected to reach the Wembley semi-finals. However, they cannot afford to rest on their laurels against the League Two outfit, who have already upset one Premier League outfit in Southampton, prevailing 2-1 away from home in the previous round. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores British woodland, grassland, freshwater and ocean habitats, revealing the surprising and dramatic wildlife that exist right on the doorstep, the existence of which is critical for the survival of species right across the globe. The first episode examines the benefits of Britain's natural geology and examines ways in which depleted islands can be restored for future generations

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Anita Rani meet volunteers doing conservation work on the River Wye, including creating a 30-acre wetland to harbour some of the river's most cherished wildlife. Adam Henson meets the farmer trying to do his bit to save the river, Tom Heap investigates why the Wye has been allowed to decline close to the point of being declared ecologically dead, and Adrian Chiles is in North Wales discovering what it takes to be a hill farmer

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: The wildlife of Britain's woodlands through the seasons, including a look at how the reintroduction of wild boar to the Forest of Dean has helped robins to find food in winter. Other creatures featured include the world's largest land slug and starlings falling prey to owls on Bodmin Moor. Plus, a look at how a subterranean network of fungi connects the whole forest together

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Clissold Park in Stoke Newington. Treasures include a collection of ancient Peruvian pottery, with some pieces made over a thousand years ago, an archive of textile designs by pioneering post-war designer Althea McNish, and Harold Wilson's pipe. Ceramics expert Serhat Ahmet challenges Fiona to work out what she should buy, sell or keep from a selection of figures by the Meissen factory

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Palmer pleads not guilty and convinces the jury of his innocence. He returns to Tenerife to run his timeshare empire, leaving his family behind. Cooper initially cooperates with the police but, after receiving a threat, he also pleads not guilty. Parry escapes to Spain but is tracked down and arrested. As the Task Force winds up, Boyce, Jennings and Brightwell make a shocking realisation - the criminals they caught only ever had half of the stolen gold

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad reviews the day's Premier League clash between Arsenal and Crystal Palace at Emirates Stadium. The title-challenging Gunners were looking to complete a double over Palace after prevailing 2-0 at Selhurst Park in August thanks to a strike by Gabriel Martinelli and a Marc Guehi own goal. Plus, a round up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: Jordan North is back on the island to catch up with the finalists about their island transformations, and the Warriors put the trainees through their paces in their last training sessions ahead of the final challenges. In the last Coach's challenge, the contestants struggle through an endurance hold in 30 degree heat, which leads to concerns that one of the trainees has pushed themselves too far. On the final day, the remaining finalists face the biggest challenge yet - Fighting Spirit

programme.title: Emma, Oti & Rylan's Big Red Nose Day Challenge
programme.desc: Emma Willis, Oti Mabuse and Rylan attempt to climb the Cairn Gorm mountain in the Scottish Highlands to raise money for Comic Relief. Starting from Braemar, the climbers receive a heroes' send off as they head away from the historic town and the toilet facilities. Their three-day expedition does not go as smoothly as they had hoped as 80mph winds threaten to end their journey before they barely get started

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast
