programme.desc: Jon Kay and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: The amazing story of a brave officer and his dog injured by a man with a zombie knife, and an appeal for information on the tragic stabbing of a teenager

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A West Midlands police officer receives life-changing injuries when a man viciously bites his finger. Plus, cameras follow Leicestershire Fire & Rescue as they train at an airport

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore a former bank in Greater Manchester, a mid-terrace in the West Midlands and a three-bedroom semi-detached near Walsall

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles hosts the show from Norwich, and visits the museum at Norwich Castle to discover East Anglia's ancient mammals. With experts Raj Bisram and Stephanie Connell

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Sid finds out the truth about Damien, while Luca lashes out. Elsewhere, Scarlett's first VPAS shift fails to go to plan

programme.title: Jay and Dom's Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Dominic Chinea demonstrate DIY tips and tricks that will not break the bank and delve into the BBC archives for advice from the nation's favourite experts. They begin by creating free-standing shelves using scaffolding poles and an old set of drawers

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown helps a Buckinghamshire couple find a new home on the Isle of Wight, and also discovers why the island is an ideal location for growing dozens of varieties of tomatoes

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Philip Serrell embark on a trip around East Anglia, where purchases include a garden fountain and a homemade post box

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: An intrepid team of four friends competes for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Ronan Keating and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zack comes up with a plan to honour his and Whitney's lost child and Lexi gets frustrated with Emma on Mother's Day. Freddie treats Jean to a slap-up lunch at The Vic and Ravi flirts with Chelsea in an attempt to put pressure on Denise to gain access to Jack's files

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the lower reaches of Royal Deeside. Heading downstream, he runs aground in a canoe and then gets stuck trying to thread his body through an ancient fertility stone. In Aberdeen, he learns a secret recipe for the city's famous rowie - a Caledonian version of the croissant. Journey's end is on the city's famous golden sands

programme.title: The Gold: The Inside Story
programme.desc: The true story of Britain's biggest bullion heist, featuring the personal accounts of the police officers who investigated the 1983 robbery at the Brink's-Mat security depot. Speaking for the first time since the robbery, Detective Chief Superintendent Brian Boyce and DC Tony Yeoman reveal the challenges they faced, the strategy they took and the tragedy that unfolded as they staked out Kenneth Noye, one of the men at the epicentre of the gang transforming the gold into cash

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob joins director Stephen Frears on the Vienna set of forthcoming drama The Palace, and looks back his career while exploring the city. Frears looks back on his breakthrough in the theatre, at the Royal Court in London in the early 1960s, through BBC's Play for Today to his movie breakthrough with My Beautiful Laundrette and Dangerous Liaisons. With contributions from Hugh Grant, Judi Dench, Steve Coogan, Hanif Kureishi, Glenn Close, John Malkovich, Jack Black, Helen Mirren and Meryl Streep

programme.title: Philomena (2013)
programme.desc: A teenager in 1950s Ireland becomes pregnant, and is sent to a home for 'fallen women', while her baby is forcibly taken from her and sent to America to be adopted. Fifty years later, she meets a disillusioned political journalist who attempts to reunite her with her son. Fact-based drama, starring Judi Dench and Steve Coogan

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Anna Maxwell Martin hosts an extended edition of the satirical panel show, with Steph McGovern and Chris McCausland joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Theo Randall and Philli Armitage-Mattin plus special guest Fleur East. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including matches in the Premier League and the sixth round of the FA Cup

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Italy (Kick-off 12.30pm). Gabby Logan presents all the action from the opening match in the final round of fixtures, held at BT Murrayfield. Scotland recorded a 33-22 victory when the sides met in Rome last year and have enjoyed some encouraging results this time around, though defeats to France and Ireland mean they no longer have a chance of winning the title. Italy have been competitive in all their matches so far, but are still without a win. With analysis from Martin Johnson and John Barclay, and commentary by Andrew Cotter, Sam Warburton and Chris Paterson

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: EJ Osborne searches for three items he can rescue and revamp at the recycling centre in Woking. An old plans chest needs some careful reworking at the hands of restorers Tom and Johnny, while woodworking wizard Norman Wilkinson is challenged with creating high-end furniture from a set of discarded garden chairs. EJ himself attempts to repurpose a pair of swivel stools

programme.title: Comic Relief
programme.desc: Highlight's of this year's Red Nose Day

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Burnley (Kick-off 5.45pm). All the action from the sixth-round tie at Etihad Stadium. Burnley are managed by former City captain Vincent Kompany, who won this trophy twice while at the club. The Clarets have performed well under his stewardship and look set for an immediate return to the Premier League. However, they face the toughest of tests against the cup favourites, who tend to be particularly ruthless against lower league opposition, as shown in their 3-0 win away to Bristol City in the previous round. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Micah Richards

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Jonathan Ross on Comic Books, Vick Hope on Pop Music, Gareth Thomas on Rugby, Victoria Derbyshire on News, Tom Allen on Gardening, Chunkz on Maths, and Sara Cox on Dogs

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Charlie questions his loyalties when Robyn is brought into the ED following a car crash just as the department reaches breaking point, with limited staff available to treat her. David and Marty make a difficult decision, Jacob realises his actions might have devastating consequences, and Faith makes a horrifying discovery

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee thinks the twins are too young to be taught about sex at school and that their teacher Miss Anstis is too stuck up to teach it. He resolves that it is his duty as a father to teach his children everything he knows about the facts of life, discovering only when it is too late that his knowledge is somewhat limited. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Single mother Amy is desperate to learn to drive to improve the lives of her kids. But after 13 years learning and two failed tests under the instruction of her own mother, both feel they are going backwards. During five days, they must try and stop Amy's panic attacks while driving

programme.title: Ups and Downs
programme.desc: A 22-year-old with Down's syndrome tricks his 18-year-old sister into a road trip to go to an Ash concert in Antrim, with the pair pursued by their panicky mother, who enlists the help of family friend Fergus to track them down. Drama, starring Susan Lynch, James Martin and Rosie Barry

programme.title: Westminster Hall
programme.desc: House of Commons proceedings in Westminster Hall from Tuesday 14 March.

programme.title: House of Commons
programme.desc: Questions in the House of Commons to the Defence Secretary Ben Wallace and his team of ministers, from Monday 13 March.

programme.title: Prime Minister's Questions
programme.desc: Questions in the House of Commons to Prime Minister Rishi Sunak from Wednesday 15 March.

programme.title: Scottish First Minister's Questions
programme.desc: Questions in the Scottish Parliament to First Minister Nicola Sturgeon from Thursday 16 March.

programme.title: First Minister's Questions
programme.desc: Questions in the Welsh Parliament to First Minister Mark Drakeford from Tuesday 14 March.

programme.title: House of Commons
programme.desc: The statement on the 2023 Budget in the House of Commons by Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt with responses from Leader of the Opposition Keir Starmer, Treasury committee chair Harriet Baldwin and SNP Economy Spokesperson Stewart Hosie, from Wednesday 15 March.

programme.title: Scottish Parliament
programme.desc: Coverage of the statement in the Scottish Parliament on the Ferguson Marine shipyard, from Thursday 16 March.

programme.title: Senedd Cymru - Welsh Parliament
programme.desc: The statement in the Senedd, the Welsh Parliament, on reform to dental services in Wales, from Tuesday 14 March.

programme.title: House of Lords
programme.desc: The debate in the House of Lords on the Barnett funding arrangements for government spending in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland, from Wednesday 15 March.

programme.title: House of Commons
programme.desc: Questions in the House of Commons to the Science, Innovation and Technology Secretary Michelle Donelan and her team of ministers, from Wednesday 22 March.

programme.title: Select Committees
programme.desc: The Northern Ireland Affairs select committee session on the effectiveness of the institutions of the Belfast/Good Friday Agreement with evidence from former Prime Minister Sir Tony Blair

programme.title: Select Committees
programme.desc: The Digital, Culture, Media and Sport select committee session on safety at sports events with evidence from Culture, Media and Sport minister Stuart Andrew and Adam Conant, Head of Sport at the Department for Culture, Media and Sport, from Tuesday 14 March.

programme.title: Select Committees
programme.desc: The Environmental Audit select committee session on the path to net zero with evidence from the Energy Security and Net Zero Secretary, Grant Shapps, from Wednesday 15 March.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid: Revenge of the Spider Queen
programme.desc: A special episode of the series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!

programme.title: Smarty Pants

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Simone offers them a space at her booth at the neighbourhood flea market, but what should they do with the money that they earn from it?

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott demonstrates meaty recipes, cooking a breakfast dish of potato rosti with black pudding, poached egg and crispy maple-sriracha bacon. Sam Holland gets a meat masterclass from a butcher and uses what he learns to make a mouth-watering steak sandwich, while TV presenter Richard Madeley reveals the secrets behind a family favourite, which is adding chicken livers to his bolognese

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: James enters the Los Angeles in style while driving a vintage Porsche. After a visit to an incredible food market in Santa Monica, he heads to the beach to cook up a storm. He also meets a pensioner who happens to be a fitness coach, drops in on old friend and chef-to-the-stars Wolfgang Puck at his Beverly Hills restaurant CUT and finishes his visit with a bite of his favourite pizza

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: France v Wales (Kick-off 2.45pm). Jill Douglas presents all the action from the match in the final round of fixtures, held at Stade de France. Les Bleus claimed a hard-fought 13-9 win in Cardiff last year en route to the Grand Slam, and although they have not quite hit the same heights this time around, they could still win the title should they win with a bonus point and Ireland lose to England. Wales have endured a difficult campaign, but they did claim a first win last time out away to Italy. With analysis from with Gareth Thomas, Jamie Roberts and Benjamin Kayser, reports by David Flatman, and commentary from Miles Harrison, Shane Williams and Ben Kay

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Ireland v England (Kick-off 5.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the final match of this year's championship, held at Aviva Stadium. Ireland claimed an impressive 32-15 win at Twickenham in last year's competition and another victory this evening would see them win the Grand Slam. In contrast, England have endured a disappointing campaign, defeating Italy and Wales, but suffering home defeats at the hands of Scotland and France, the latter which was a 53-10 thrashing last time out. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Brian O'Driscoll, Rory Best and Clive Woodward, commentary by Nick Mullins, Gordon D'Arcy and Lawrence Dallaglio, and reports from Martin Bayfield

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. His genius still unappreciated, Fizz decides to go on a spiritual retreat in a forest clearing, but Mr Magoo, who believes that he's on an orangutan reserve, mistakes the hamster for a feral child.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz invents the MutoFizz, a device which can render anyone mute... even the President! However, when Mr Magoo gets his hands on the invention, Fizz and Weasel end up mute, and he mistakes them for Parisian mimes.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd is trapped under an upside-down glass by Biggo along with Ricotta the wasp and Julie the spider - with no idea when or if Biggo will be back, Julie and Ricotta are both starting to get hungry - and Lloyd's looking rather tasty.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Sheffield United v Blackburn Rovers (Kick-off 12.00pm). Laura Woods presents all the action from the sixth-round tie at Bramall Lane, as the Championship sides battle it out for a place in the Wembley semi-finals. The Blades upset Tottenham Hotspur here with a 1-0 win in the previous round thanks to Iliman Ndiaye's late strike. Blackburn also prevailed against Premier League opposition in round five, when goals by Tyrhys Dolan and Sammie Szmodics helped them to a 2-1 triumph at Leicester City. With analysis from Eni Aluko and Jobi McAnuff, reports by Katie Shanahan, and commentary from Clive Tyldesley and Ally McCoist

programme.title: Celebrity Lingo
programme.desc: RuPaul hosts as Charlotte Church and Carys Eleri, Clare Balding and Alice Arnold, and Rickie Haywood-Williams and Melvin Odoom try to use their powers of deduction to fill in the blanks and find the missing words in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. programme.title: You've Been Framed!

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Manchester United v Fulham (Kick-off 4.30pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the sixth-round tie at Old Trafford. United have already eliminated two Premier League teams here in this season's competition in Everton and West Ham, but the Cottagers, who defeated Leeds United in the previous round, could provide a sterner test. However, it was the Red Devils who prevailed 2-1 when the teams met at Craven Cottage in November. With analysis from Karen Carney, Roy Keane and Ian Wright, commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon, and interviews by Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: France v Wales (Kick-off 2.45pm). Jill Douglas presents all the action from the match in the final round of fixtures, held at Stade de France. Les Bleus claimed a hard-fought 13-9 win in Cardiff last year en route to the Grand Slam, and although they have not quite hit the same heights this time around, they could still win the title should they win with a bonus point and Ireland lose to England. Wales have endured a difficult campaign, but they did claim a first win last time out away to Italy. With analysis from with Gareth Thomas, Jamie Roberts and Benjamin Kayser, reports by David Flatman, and commentary from Miles Harrison, Shane Williams and Ben Kay

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Ireland v England (Kick-off 5.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the final match of this year's championship, held at Aviva Stadium. Ireland claimed an impressive 32-15 win at Twickenham in last year's competition and another victory this evening would see them win the Grand Slam. In contrast, England have endured a disappointing campaign, defeating Italy and Wales, but suffering home defeats at the hands of Scotland and France, the latter which was a 53-10 thrashing last time out. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Brian O'Driscoll, Rory Best and Clive Woodward, commentary by Nick Mullins, Gordon D'Arcy and Lawrence Dallaglio, and reports from Martin Bayfield

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Sheffield United v Blackburn Rovers (Kick-off 12.00pm). Laura Woods presents all the action from the sixth-round tie at Bramall Lane, as the Championship sides battle it out for a place in the Wembley semi-finals. The Blades upset Tottenham Hotspur here with a 1-0 win in the previous round thanks to Iliman Ndiaye's late strike. Blackburn also prevailed against Premier League opposition in round five, when goals by Tyrhys Dolan and Sammie Szmodics helped them to a 2-1 triumph at Leicester City. programme.desc: The duo are hired to create a garden as a wedding present, and find a baby under a gooseberry bush. The discovery brings out Rosemary's maternal side as the pair investigate who abandoned the child. Their task is complicated by the murder of an artistic neighbour - and the two mysterious incidents appear to be connected. Starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo visit a resort in Spain to create a trophy garden for a pro-am tennis tournament run by a former champion. When one of the competitors is found dead, everyone assumes it to be a gruesome accident - but there is more to the case than meets the eye. While investigating, Laura enters the mysterious world of bullfighting, and Rosemary rediscovers her love of motor scooters

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Sergeant Troy is promoted to Inspector, but before he can consider his future he has to help Barnaby investigate the collapse of a tunnel which has exposed a collection of ancient skeletons - and more recent remains among the bones suggest links to a nearby double shooting. Murder mystery, starring John Nettles, Daniel Casey, Cherie Lunghi and David Bradley

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A local woman is found murdered following a row with her husband at a residents' association Spanish-themed evening. The finger of suspicion soon points to an odd-job man with a violent history, and the chairman of the association reveals he heard a squeaking noise after the victim left - but the witness promptly winds up dead himself. Crime drama, starring John Nettles

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An amateur archaeologist publishes a book about his father's discovery of Celtic artefacts in an ancient mound, and plans a celebration on the site - but landowner Gareth Heldman is less than keen on the idea. While out walking, Joyce spots Heldman arguing with a woman, and hours later he winds up stabbed to death with an old weapon that bears a striking resemblance to the one found during the dig. John Nettles and John Hopkins star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott investigate the murder of a prize-winning author on the eve of the Midsomer Literary Festival. The event goes ahead as planned, but a killing occurs during a blackout at a packed reception hosted by the widow of another writer, and it is not long before the detectives uncover corruption, sexual scandal and financial mismanagement. Guest starring Stella Gonet, with John Nettles and John Hopkins

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The killing of a postman, whose doorstep deliveries often included more than just letters, rocks the idyllic rural hamlet of Goodman's Land and sends Barnaby on the trail of a murderer with vengeance in mind - if Sgt Troy can keep his eyes off the attractive village policewoman long enough to follow the clues. Murder mystery, guest starring Robert Glenister, with John Nettles, Daniel Casey and Gillian Kearney

programme.title: Arthur & George
programme.desc: Martin Clunes plays celebrated novelist and physician Arthur Conan Doyle in this adaptation of Julian Barnes' novel. The drama is based on real events in the Sherlock Holmes creator's life, as he pursues a notorious miscarriage of justice. It's 1906, and Sir Arthur and his trusted secretary Alfred 'Woodie' Wood investigate the case of George Edalji, a young Anglo-Indian solicitor who was imprisoned for allegedly mutilating animals and writing obscene letters. With Charles Edwards, Arsher Ali, Art Malik, Emma Fielding, Hattie Morahan, Conleth Hill and Sandra Voe

programme.title: Arthur & George
programme.desc: After the escape of their late-night assailant, Arthur, Woodie and the Edaljis are surprised by the arrival of George at the vicarage. His boots are covered in mud, which leads Woodie to suspect he is the Wyrley Ripper after all, but Arthur is not convinced, believing the young solicitor is the victim of racial prejudice - and possibly police corruption. Feathers are ruffled as the novelist visits the officers who investigated the case, and soon after, another recipient of the poison-pen letters, the local blacksmith, is killed in his home

programme.title: Arthur & George
programme.desc: Determined to prove his critics wrong and find out whether George has been hiding anything, Arthur attacks the case with renewed fervour, uncovering fresh evidence that suggests a very different explanation to the one found by the police. However, he and Woodie are led into further danger when it seems the Wyrley Ripper is still at large. On a mission that could expose corruption in the establishment, will Arthur be able to show the world that the young solicitor is innocent? Martin Clunes stars in the period drama

programme.desc: The green-fingered amateur detectives work on a garden for an open-air theatre, where Rosemary's cousin is due to perform. programme.desc: Green-fingered amateur detectives Laura and Rosemary are called in to tackle a stubborn species of weed threatening an entire year's vintage at the Crickle Valley vineyard. programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: Regan and Carter discover a road accident victim was a gang member involved in a wages robbery, and Regan is determined to nail the modern-day Bonnie and Clyde who have already made fools of the police. John Thaw and Dennis Waterman star

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur swaps the contents of his lock-up for a slot-machine full of stolen money during a trip to the fair. Unfortunately the incriminating item is passed to Morley, who uses it at a charity event, and a showdown between cops and robbers ensues. Vintage comedy drama, starring George Cole, Nicholas Day and Gary Webster

programme.title: Dempsey and Makepeace
programme.desc: Spikings finds his life in danger when he investigates the kidnapping of a police informant's son _ and uncovers corruption at the heart of SI-10. Police drama, starring Michael Brandon and Glynis Barber

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: The outlaws enter a mysterious village where their every wish is granted - unaware they are being duped by the evil Gulnar, who is intent on reviving a bloodthirsty pagan deity. Jason Connery stars

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade heads to Russia's remote Amur River, where the mysterious deaths of three men appear to be linked to a freshwater giant - a beast that can exceed 18ft in length and weigh more than a ton. However, he encounters a wall of silence and begins to suspect he has stumbled on to a dark secret that isn't supposed to be uncovered

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: News of a violent attack in a remote Mongolian river has Jeremy Wade wondering if it could be the work of a giant fish so rare that it's more legend than fact. But with illegal gold miners poisoning the last hideouts of this man-sized monster, it's anyone's guess whether the creature is still alive and biting

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: Thomas misses his class reunion to look for an attorney who has been kidnapped while trying to expose a leak in the police department. Detective drama, starring Tom Selleck

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A business tycoon is blackmailed for his part in a massacre while serving in the Army 25 years earlier. However, his problems are compounded after he seeks help from his former commanding officer. Colin Jeavons guest stars, with John Thaw

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: A face from the past spreads stories that cause Arthur and Dave to fall out, and the camel-coated entrepreneur opens a rival establishment to the Winchester Club. However, Ray harbours doubts concerning the instigator's honesty. George Cole, Gary Webster and Glynn Edwards star

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: The team heads to the seaside town of Rockingham in Western Australia to try and salvage a 34-foot yacht called the Renee Louise

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh host with the quiz, as Scott Mills, Gareth Malone, Louise Minchin and Glenn Hoddle pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: The Grand Fishing Adventure
programme.desc: Ali and Bobby head off on the final leg of their British Isles tour to a lake in Essex, where they fly fish for trout. The main event follows at one of Britain's premier carp waters, Grenville in Cambridgeshire. The mission here is for Bobby to beat his UK carp PB - he must put in a man of the match performance to succeed. Daniel Clifford pays the boys a visit and sets his last bankside cooking challenge

programme.title: Speed (1994)
programme.desc: An LAPD cop discovers a psychotic criminal has planted a bomb on a crowded bus, primed to go off if the vehicle drops below 50mph. He boards the vehicle and helps a hapless passenger who has been forced to take the wheel and keep a constant speed to avoid a disaster. Action thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Sandra Bullock, Dennis Hopper and Jeff Daniels

He also champions the virtues of tinned fish with a speedy pasta dish, and shares his recipe for a low-cost chocolate fridge cake that uses up the odds and ends from the store cupboard

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Two-part special following the case of a naked man found stabbed to death in Luton, which leads police to discover this may be one of a series of murders in which men are lured with the promise of sex, so that they can be robbed. DI Dale Mepstead turns her attention to two men who are seen on CCTV accompanying the suspects into a flat. Will either of the women being held in custody reveal their identity?

programme.title: Rise and Fall
programme.desc: Reality contest, which sees a diverse group from all walks of life become part of a social experiment that asks how wealth and power shape the way people behave toward one another. In this episode, the action continues as the first Ruler is eliminated from the game, and there's an opportunity for one Grafter to rise to a position of power

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics review Wild Isles, Starstruck, The Apprentice, MILF Manor, The Piano and Married at First Sight Australia. They also share their thoughts on an unusual edition Match of the Day and, rather conveniently, the ITV News on Gary Lineker

programme.title: Send Nudes: Body SOS
programme.desc: Vogue Williams meets Becky, who has lost 11 stone, but gained pounds of excess skin, and Drag Queen Solero, who wants a more shapely bum But as they both confront their life-size naked avatars, will they decide to push ahead with their plans for surgery or will their minds be changed by what they see in front of them and hear from our feedback panel?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Italian family restaurant Sabatiello's in Stamford, Connecticut, where the owner's fiery temper upsets the staff and has left him more than $1million in debt. Gordon's help is urgently needed to get customers back through the door, but the restaurateur does not take kindly to criticism and closes the restaurant down when his employees turn on him

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Perfectionist Michelle and her husband, Bryan Adams tribute singer Russell, host first in Cheltenham, on a night when a budding bromance starts to develop. On night two Calum and fiancee Lydia have a rustic theme. While their food doesn't seem to quite hit the mark, Calum's impromptu am dram performances do. Finally, Jane and Paul's menu celebrates Jane's favourite things, but gets mixed reviews

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Businesswoman Deborah Meaden, actress Fay Ripley and space scientist Dr Maggie Aderin-Pocock accompany Sandi Toksvig as she travels to Norway. Maggie and Sandi go in search of killer whales during a stay in an architectural gem designed for guests to enjoy the wonders of the Northern Lights from their sofa, Deborah Meaden swaps the Dragons Den for a face to face meeting with a pack of wolves and it really is Cold Feet for Fay Ripley when in sub-zero temperatures she and Sandi venture to a mountain-top glass cabin

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Stonemason Adam Purchase and his partner Nicola Brennan try to restore a dilapidated Grade II-listed silver-mine engine-house in Cornwall. With a budget of ¬£100,000, Adam takes a year off work to transform the property into a new home, but has to rely on favours to complete the project before he runs out of time

Her first guest is TV presenter and former Strictly winner Ore Oduba, who indulges in a luxury three-day tour of the Lake District. programme.title: Enigma: The Monster of Loch Ness
programme.desc: A look at Professor Neil Gemmell's search for evidence of the creature that purportedly lurks in the loch. Using cutting-edge technology, he attempted to assert whether there is a plesiosaur in Loch Ness - or perhaps a Greenland shark or giant eels. His findings sent him on a collision course with the passionate local community devoted to one of the world's greatest monster myths

programme.title: Into Death Valley with Nick Knowles
programme.desc: Part one of two. Nick ventures into one of the least hospitable places on Earth, a region in southwest America where the world's highest temperature of 57 C was recorded in 1913 and which at 282ft below sea level is also one of the lowest spots on the planetIn the hottest place on Earth. Nick goes sand-buggy driving, experiences dawn at Zabriskie Point, and meets survival expert Tom Coyne, who shows him how to forage for food, find water and make a fire

programme.title: Britpop: The Music That Changed Britain
programme.desc: The story of 1995 when Britpop took over the charts, and the rivalry between Blur and Oasis in the fight for the UK number one single was reported on the 9 O'Clock News. Pulp's Candida Doyle and Nick Banks relate their band's long, painful journey from the sidelines to the top table and their incredulity when frontman and perennial outsider Jarvis Cocker became a sex symbol

programme.title: Britain's Great Cathedrals with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: The actor visits York Minster, which over the past 800 years, has been a backdrop to some of the most dramatic events in British history. It houses more than half of all the world's medieval glass, including the Rose Window, commissioned by Henry VIII, and the East Window, the largest stained glass window in the world. A succession of outspoken bishops of York have defied Nazis, married kings and queens, and more recently championed equality with Archbishop John Sentamu, the country's first black bishop, consecrating the world's first female bishop, Libby Lane, in 2014

programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Near York, a car thief rams officers off the road at high-speed and causes thousands of pounds worth of damage before he is eventually stopped and arrested. After a gang travels into North Yorkshire for some high-end shoplifting, police track down a car in Leeds and move in for an arrest

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: Patients are flooding into Barnsley A&E and a woman who has come in with a stomach ache goes into labour - and she had no idea she was pregnant. Next to arrive by ambulance is 87-year-old Ken, who had a fall at home and has a nasty cut to his forehead and cheek, so student doctor Saba Azizi stitches his cut while nurse Amy treats the wound on his cheek

programme.title: 999: Critical Condition
programme.desc: Cara has fallen 50 metres down a waterfall. She has multiple obvious injuries that need urgent care, but trauma specialist Dr Richard Fawcett must also investigate hidden internal injuries that are an immediate threat to life

programme.title: A&E After Dark
programme.desc: A patient ignores hospital policy and refuses to leave A&E after his treatment and staff and security end up in the firing line when he lashes out aggressively, while doctor Sean assesses 27-year-old Chris, who lost control of his motorbike and crushed his leg

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: An ill wind blows through Worksop tonight when a Ford Focus seemingly fails to stop for Lewis and Rich. The suspected driver is away on his toes, but police dog Quantum follows his nose to an outdoor toilet. Sure enough, hiding inside, a few yards from the runaway car, is a suspect who swears he's just dropped by to answer the call of nature - in a stranger's toilet

programme.title: Motorway: Hell on the Highway
programme.desc: One motorist goes airborne following an encounter with a roundabout. Cameras also focus on the difficulties of driving on black ice by examining three case studies, including an incident in New Jersey when a massive lorry jackknifes and vaults the central reservation

programme.title: The LeoVegas Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: Britain's Parking Hell
programme.desc: Documentary following the daily battles across Britain for parking spaces, looking at the struggles faced by motorists, councils and private parking companies

programme.title: Britain's Parking Hell
programme.desc: Documentary following the daily battles across Britain for parking spaces, looking at the struggles faced by motorists, councils and private parking companies

programme.title: Building Britain's Canals
programme.desc: Dan Jones examines Britain's most iconic canals, beginning with the 152-mile Grand Union Canal, which runs up the spine of the country. Constructed at the height of the Industrial Revolution, the task challenged even the greatest engineering minds of the time, including pioneers such as James Brindley, the man behind Britain's first commercial canal, and William Jessop, the person with whom responsibility lay for the building of the main link from Birmingham to London. Travelling along its route, Dan experiences first-hand the innovations behind its construction, including the Blisworth tunnel

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Steele's old fire engine Bessie is used in an emergency at the mountain activity centre - where gas canisters are in danger of exploding

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Cap'n Turbot's weather blimp is stolen by Mayor Humdinger, who thinks that it can chase away the clouds in Foggy Bottom

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Animation for younger viewers following the adventures of the cheeky piglet, her brother George and their friends

programme.title: Puss in Boots (2011)
programme.desc: The swashbuckling feline joins forces with a cunning thief and a treacherous old friend to steal a magical golden goose from a giant's castle. He must save the day when it transpires that their actions have unleashed a terrible danger on his home town. Animated comedy spin-off from the Shrek movies, with the voices of Antonio Banderas and Salma Hayek

programme.title: Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa (2008)
programme.desc: The escaped zoo animals discover a plane and, following a swift repair job by the penguins, manage to escape the desolate shores of Madagascar. However, they crash-land on the plains of Africa and find themselves face-to-face with their wild counterparts for the first time. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer and Jada Pinkett Smith

programme.title: Bend It Like Beckham (2002)
programme.desc: An English schoolgirl tries to hide her passion for football from her strict Indian parents, knowing they disapprove of her tomboyish love of the game. However, when a semi-professional player sees her in action, she is offered a place on a team, forcing her to come up with a complex plan to keep her sporting career under wraps. Comedy, with Parminder Nagra, Keira Knightley, Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Juliet Stevenson and Shaznay Lewis

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle (2016)
programme.desc: Biopic of British sporting underdog Eddie Edwards. Determined to fulfil his dreams of becoming an Olympic athlete, Edwards trains as a ski jumper - a field in which Britain had no other competitors. He secures a place in the 1988 Winter Olympics, where his can-do attitude makes him a media sensation in the face of a losing streak. Starring Taron Egerton, Hugh Jackman and Christopher Walken

programme.title: I, Robot (2004)
programme.desc: The inventor of an advanced form of intelligent robot is found dead, and the detective investigating the case is certain that one of the scientist's mechanical creations is responsible - but no one believes his theory because the robots have been programmed to prevent them from harming humans. Sci-fi thriller, inspired by the Isaac Asimov stories, starring Will Smith, Bridget Moynahan and Alan Tudyk

programme.title: The Equalizer (2014)
programme.desc: A retired secret agent applies his talents to the task of helping victims of injustice. When he witnesses a prostitute being beaten up by a pimp, he kills the man, an act that draws him into a battle to the death with a Russian crime syndicate. Action thriller based on the 1980s TV series, starring Denzel Washington and Chloe Grace Moretz

programme.title: The Equalizer 2 (2018)
programme.desc: Robert McCall divides his time between cab driving and looking after a young man who is mixing with a bad crowd. When a CIA friend is murdered, the former black ops agent sets out to avenge her death, and winds up fighting for survival in his hurricane-battered home town. Action thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Pedro Pascal and Ashton Sanders

programme.title: Cube (1997)
programme.desc: Seven disparate strangers awake in a bizarre labyrinth laced with deadly traps, and face the fight of their lives to regain their freedom. Sci-fi horror filmed on one set, starring Nicole deBoer, Nicky Guadagni, David Hewlett and Andrew Miller

programme.title: Wonder (2017)
programme.desc: A 10-year-old boy with facial disfigurements that have so far required almost 30 operations takes on a whole new challenge when, after being home educated his entire life, enters mainstream school for the first time. As he struggles to fit in, his fellow pupils and the community are forced to learn the power of compassion and acceptance. Julia Roberts, Owen Wilson and Jacob Tremblay star in Stephen Chbosky's drama, based on the best-selling novel by RJ Palacio

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire (1993)
programme.desc: A struggling actor's ambitious, no-nonsense wife throws him out and demands a divorce. Desperate to spend time with his children, he puts his talents to good use by donning drag and posing as a British housekeeper to get a job looking after them. Comedy, starring Robin Williams, Sally Field, Pierce Brosnan, Harvey Fierstein and Mara Wilson

programme.title: Bumblebee (2018)
programme.desc: In 1987, Californian teenager Charlie Watson is traumatised by the death of her father, while her mother Sally and new boyfriend Ron leaves her feeling even more alone. For her 18th-birthday she's given a yellow Volkswagen Beetle, which turns out to be the battle-scarred Autobot Bumblebee. Transformers prequel, starring Hailee Steinfeld, John Cena and Jorge Lendeborg Jr

programme.title: The Banshees of Inisherin Interview Special
programme.desc: The In Bruges team of Colin Farrell, Brendan Gleeson and writer/director Martin McDonagh talk about making their new film together, The Banshees of Inisherin

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse (2016)
programme.desc: The mutant heroes face the oldest and most powerful of their kind, an ancient Egyptian tyrant who is restored to life in the 1980s and plans to destroy civilisation and rebuild it in his own image. Awakening after thousands of years, he recruits the disheartened Magneto and other mutants to create a new world order. As the fate of Earth hangs in the balance, Professor X and Raven lead a team of young X-Men to stop their seemingly invincible nemesis from destroying mankind. Superhero adventure sequel, starring James McAvoy, Michael Fassbender, Jennifer Lawrence and Oscar Isaac

programme.title: Cast Away (2000)
programme.desc: A manager for an American courier service has to fend for himself when a plane crash leaves him stranded alone on a desert island. Initially panic-stricken, he overcomes his terror to survive for four years on his own before building a raft and setting off on an epic journey back home. Adventure drama, starring Tom Hanks, Helen Hunt, Nick Searcy, Lari White and Chris Noth

programme.title: Calm with Horses (2019)
programme.desc: Douglas 'Arm' Armstrong has become a feared enforcer for the drug-dealing Devers family, while also trying to be a good father. Torn between these two families, Arm's loyalties are tested when he is asked to kill for the first time. Crime drama, starring Cosmo Jarvis, Barry Keoghan and Niamh Algar

programme.title: Chained for Life (2018)
programme.desc: An actress struggles to connect with her disfigured co-star on the set of a European auteur's English-language debut. Writer/director Aaron Schimberg's comedy drama, starring Jess Weixler and Adam Pearson

programme.title: The Fingerspellers
programme.desc: Comedy about a family of deaf gangsters who use signing to protect their interests. When the Opera family threaten their dominance, a fingerspelling war ensues

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass (1967)
programme.desc: A cavalry captain sets out to deliver a shipment of rifles to a fort besieged by marauding Apaches, but the mission is undermined by a villainous corporal who plans to steal the weapons and sell them to the enemy. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Michael Burns, Laraine Stephens, Kenneth Tobey and Michael Keep

programme.title: At Gunpoint (1955)
programme.desc: A peaceable shopkeeper becomes a local hero when he accidentally kills the leader of a gang of bank robbers. However, when the dead bandit's partners in crime come looking for retribution, he finds the friends and neighbours who praised his bravery are now about to abandon him. Western, starring Fred MacMurray, Dorothy Malone and Walter Brennan

programme.title: Billion Dollar Brain (1967)
programme.desc: Former secret agent Harry Palmer comes out of retirement to take a mysterious canister to Finland, and ends up embroiled in an American megalomaniac's bid to take over the world. Espionage thriller, directed by Ken Russell and starring Michael Caine, Oscar Homolka and Karl Malden

programme.title: O.S.S. (1946)
programme.desc: A spy is parachuted into France shortly before D-Day to complete a perilous top-secret mission. His team of expert operatives includes a strong-minded female agent - but sparks fly when the pair begin to work together, a situation which looks likely to lead to a crisis of conscience. Second World War adventure, starring Alan Ladd, Geraldine Fitzgerald, Patric Knowles and Richard Benedict

programme.title: My Super Ex-Girlfriend (2006)
programme.desc: Ordinary New Yorker Matt starts dating a woman he meets on the subway, unaware she is the superhero G-Girl. When he breaks up with the insecure crimefighter, she is outraged and uses her superpowers to make his life a misery. Meanwhile, her arch-enemy sees Matt as a potential ally in defeating G-Girl once and for all. Fantasy comedy, starring Uma Thurman, Luke Wilson and Eddie Izzard

programme.title: The Banshees of Inisherin Interview Special
programme.desc: The In Bruges team of Colin Farrell, Brendan Gleeson and writer/director Martin McDonagh talk about making their new film together, The Banshees of Inisherin

programme.title: Deadpool (2016)
programme.desc: A fast-talking former mercenary develops terminal cancer and agrees to be the subject in a shady experiment in the hope of a cure. The procedure leaves him horribly disfigured, but also possessing superhuman abilities which he immediately puts to use in a quest for revenge on the man responsible for his hideous appearance. Superhero comedy adventure, starring Ryan Reynolds and Morena Baccarin

programme.title: Punisher: War Zone (2008)
programme.desc: The ruthless vigilante considers hanging up his guns when he learns a gangster he killed was actually an undercover FBI agent. However, he must return to his war on crime when a mobster who was hideously disfigured at his hands assembles a gang of violent criminals to cause mayhem on the streets of New York. Action thriller based on the Marvel comic-book, starring Ray Stevenson and Dominic West

programme.title: Thunderbolt and Lightfoot (1974)
programme.desc: Retired bank robber John Doherty escapes a gunman with the aid of a young car thief, and together they go in search of the loot from the former crook's last job. When they discover the stash is missing - and John's thuggish old partners are also looking for it - the pair decide to do a repeat robbery. Comedy drama, starring Clint Eastwood, Jeff Bridges, George Kennedy and Geoffrey Lewis

Meanwhile, Howard finds Stuart's relationship with his mother strange, and Penny has an interview for a sales job at Bernadette's workplace. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989)
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist sets out to find his estranged father, who has gone missing while searching for the Holy Grail. Action adventure sequel directed by Steven Spielberg, the third instalment in the successful franchise. programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Spanish architect Jaime and his wife Mimi as they embark on a mission to convert a Grade II listed folly into a family home in Buckinghamshire. Giving themselves a wildly optimistic six-month deadline to finish before the birth of their second child, it's not long before the couple hit trouble. Jaime puts all his energies and creativity into the project, using innovative 3D mapping to squeeze living spaces into the tower, but it proves to be an exhausting struggle

programme.title: Jonathan Ross' Myths and Legends
programme.desc: Jonathan is joined by Michael Sheen to explore the legends of Wales, from the creation of Mount Snowdon to the Lady of the Lake, and attends the Green Man Festival

programme.title: Secret History
programme.desc: One of the most devastating pandemics in human history, the Black Death swept through London in 1348, killing old and young, rich and poor, within days of their first symptoms. Received wisdom has long suggested the culprit was bubonic plague, spread by the fleas of infected rats, and an unexpected discovery made by Crossrail engineers working on a shaft on the edge of London's Charterhouse Square in 2013 provides a new insight into how the disease passed from host to host. This documentary follows experts from a range of disciplines as they pick through the evidence, reveal why the disease killed on such a large scale, and discuss how it still poses a threat today

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Train driver Andy, 48, is rushed in after falling 12ft from a tree while cutting branches and landing on his feet, badly fracturing both ankles, and doctors are concerned the impact may have caused life-changing damage to critical nerves and blood vessels in his feet and legs. Angela, 59, has come to St George's as her heart has been beating at over 150bpm for eight hours, risking stroke and other complications. Cardiologist Dr Arun's attempts to bring down her pulse using a powerful drug aren't successful, so he decides to electrically shock her heart to reset it

In an effort to determine Carol's motivations, Lee joins Frank's dating app and puts himself forward as a potential date for her. If she bites, he will know she's up to no good. Jeremy Clarkson pilots the Lexus LFA, which has a spectacularly high-revving V10 powerplant, Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the muscular Dodge Viper, and James May opts for the latest incarnation of Aston Martin's Vanquish. On their journey from Las Vegas to Palm Springs via Los Angeles, the presenters tackle racing circuits and find themselves in a race against the police, before rushing to the Mexican border - and there's a terrifying penalty for the last man to arrive. A price restriction leads Jeremy to grab the keys to a Shelby Mustang GT500, which costs the equivalent of ¬£35,000 in America and packs a supercharged punch of more than 650bhp. James and Richard pin their hopes on the pan-European rail network in a bid to secure the prize of tickets to a top-flight football match, with nothing but a long journey home awaiting the losers. On the test track, Jeremy puts Toyota's GT86 coupe through its paces, and its promise of entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling should put a smile on his face. programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Maritime engineering in recent years has seen ever bigger ships and sea-based platforms constructed. On occasion, they may need moving, which is the purpose of the Boka Vanguard, the planet's largest heavy lift ship, capable of sinking itself, floating under its cargo and then lifting it up to be moved anywhere on the planet with sea. This extraordinary work of engineering is capable of carrying the Eiffel Tower and the Statue of Liberty at the same time

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's 1930s Bradshaw's-inspired railway tour continues in north Wales. In Colwyn Bay, Michael hears how an army of civil servants from the Ministries of Food and Agriculture in London invaded the quiet seaside town, before visiting an amusement park in the holiday resort of Rhyl. Crossing the Menai Strait by the Britannia Bridge, Michael arrives on Anglesey and the elegant seat of the Marquesses of the island

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his 1936 Bradshaw's-inspired railway tour of north Wales. He begins in the coastal city of Bangor, where he hears how, when war broke out in September 1939, 2,000 children from the cities of northern England were evacuated by train to north Wales. Heading inland alongside the River Conwy, Michael reaches Tal y Cafn, before investigating the worst dam disaster in Welsh history in Dolgarrog. Finally in Betws y Coed, he attempts to climb one of Snowdonia's lesser peaks

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords

programme.desc: The pursuit of a reckless getaway driver in a stolen car ends with a full-scale air-to-ground search for a suspect, and a battle to save his life. programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The road crime team leads a county lines drugs crackdown in Chesterfield, capturing three suspects believed to be ferrying crack cocaine and heroin into Derbyshire on a regular basis. programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Yorkshire police forces tackling an ever-more sophisticated criminal fraternity from the cities to the Dales. Jamie Theakston narrates

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Sgt Carlin arrests a gang of van thieves and uncovers a major criminal operation in the process, while a late-night compost thief is caught on his way out of the shower. programme.title: Police Interceptors

Crime drama, directed by and starring Patrick McGoohan, with Peter Falk and Leslie Nielsen

Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, James Read, Paul Burke, Jo Anderson and Nancy Walker

programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: Warehouse 13
programme.desc: Pete, Myka, Claudia, and Steve race to reverse the sweating sickness that Artie has unleashed before it becomes a worldwide pandemic. The only problem is, they are already succumbing themselves, so must stop the disease before it stops them. Sci-fi thriller, starring Eddie McClintock, Joanne Kelly and Saul Rubinek

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: When Picard is chosen to mediate in a Klingon power struggle over who will seize control of the Empire, and Worf confronts Duras, who falsely accused the Starfleet officer's father of treachery and brought shame on his family in the eyes of his species. Patrick Stewart and Michael Dorn star

programme.title: Star Trek: Enterprise
programme.desc: The crew members are ambushed by a hostile Klingon when they board a stricken vessel, and find themselves stranded on the floundering ship. Sci-fi drama, starring Scott Bakula and Jolene Blalock

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: Disillusioned by the inflexibility of Starfleet's regime, Tom Paris plans to leave Voyager and join a Talaxian convoy. When Neelix finds out he decides to draw on his new-found journalistic skills to pursue the case

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Don Lambert, an accountant who offered to testify against weapons trafficker Hugo Garza, dies after slipping away from the Federal Marshals tasked with keeping him safe ahead of the trial. In an attempt to ensure justice is done, Pride offers to personally escort a replacement witness - Lambert's former business partner - to the trial in Texas. However, the killer is still out there, and it's not long before Pride, Sonja and their witness face an ambush. Naval crime drama, starring Scott Bakula

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: The team's search for an abducted teenager leads them to a member of the Witness Protection Programme and a decades-old political extremist group. Plus, Hondo and his girlfriend disagree over a guest speaker at her community centre, Luca worries he's not physically ready to return to the field, and Commander Hicks reconnects with his estranged son

programme.title: Grimm
programme.desc: Nick takes Juliette for a weekend away in the country, planning to propose - only to encounter a seemingly normal rustic couple who are not what they seem. Romance is also in the air for Hank and Monroe, who each find themselves on the brink of new relationships

programme.title: Snapped
programme.desc: Police draw blanks as they sift through ashes for clues when a body is discovered in a burning car's trunk. Has someone gotten away with murder?

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Stuart Hamilton and Liz Yardley investigate the crimes of Fritz Honka, who killed at least four sex-workers in Hamburg in the 1970s, hiding their dismembered bodies around his home

programme.title: The Force: North East
programme.desc: A Special Constable gets an unpleasant introduction to frontline policing. Officers respond to an urgent call in Newcastle city centre

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: The Most Dangerous Ways to School
programme.desc: Children who take treacherous journeys to school, climbing up mountainous paths, swimming across rivers or fighting their way through icy wastelands

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six uncovers a plot in which interim Number Two has asked the rebellious old watchmaker to design a time bomb inside a retirement trophy for his predecessor

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: A stray cat wearing a cone-shaped collar turns out to be living a double life. A highly spirited cat called Charlie gets his annual check-up and a sphynx cat called Vader is treated for painful spots on his tummy

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: Hitler's Bodyguard
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how Hitler selected his inner circle of bodyguards upon becoming Chancellor of Germany

programme.title: On the Fiddle (1961)
programme.desc: A Second World War black marketeer is arrested, but a judge forces him to join the army rather than sending him to prison. He soon finds a willing accomplice in an easy-going fellow recruit, and together they concoct a variety of underhanded schemes to avoid being sent to the front line. Comedy based on RF Delderfield's novel, starring Alfred Lynch and Sean Connery

programme.title: Where the River Runs Black (1986)
programme.desc: A priest ventures deep into the Amazon to set up a mission, and has a son with a mysterious woman. When both are killed, the boy ventures out of the jungle and travels to a city, where he is taken in by his father's kindly mentor - but the youth struggles to adapt to modern living. Drama, starring Alessandro Rabelo and Charles Durning

programme.title: Five Clues to Fortune (1957)
programme.desc: A group of children search for the treasure hidden in a monastery before the building is sold. Children's mystery, starring David Hemmings and John Rogers

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours for locals and tourists, exploring Elephant & Castle and Croydon. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Princess Margaret
programme.desc: Princess Margaret's tour of Mauritius and East Africa in 1956

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Miss Matty confides in Mary about Mr Holbrook's death, prompting her to inform Major Gordon of Jessie's regret over not marrying him. Dr Harrison tells Rev Hutton of his intentions toward Sophy and asks permission to court her, blissfully unaware that the generosity he has shown to Mrs Rose has accidentally created an unlikely love triangle. Penultimate episode of the costume drama, starring Judi Dench and Simon Woods

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours for locals and tourists, exploring Elephant & Castle and Croydon. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: It is one year on and much to everyone's surprise, party girl Jessica is getting married, while Katie catches the eye of a new colleague and Trudi worries there is something lacking in her relationship with Richard. Siobhan is living a charmed life, with Hari at home looking after baby Elsa and even ex-lover Dominic sharing babysitting duties. But it soon becomes clear things are far from simple and she is harbouring a dark secret. Sarah Parish, Shelley Conn, Orla Brady and Sharon Small star

programme.title: The Firm (1988)
programme.desc: Disturbing drama about an estate agent named Bex who leads a double life as the head of a band of organised football thugs. Bex hatches a plan to unite the various gangs in his area and lead them on a trip to Germany to confront their Dutch hooligan rivals at the 1988 European Championship. Gary Oldman stars, with Phil Davis and Lesley Manville

programme.title: My Day (2019)
programme.desc: A drug mule hopes to leave her life behind, but an encounter with a duplicitous client leaves her injured and in debt to her boss. To make up for the money that was stolen from her, she is forced to take on one last assignment. Crime drama, starring Hannah Laresa Smith and Mike Kinsey

programme.title: London Districts

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the Scottish Highlands' peaks and heather moorlands, where a mix of mammals and birds have adapted to an ecology that is unique in Britain. He waits until dawn to witness the black grouse's secretive courtship display, encounters a herd of reindeer and scales the Cairngorms to spot a mountain hare

programme.title: The Bulldog Breed (1960)
programme.desc: A bumbling grocer is rejected by the woman of his dreams, plunging him into misery. He decides to get over his heartbreak by joining the Navy, and despite his ineptitude, is selected by an admiral to become Britain's first astronaut. Comedy, starring Norman Wisdom, Ian Hunter, David Lodge and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: North West Frontier (1959)
programme.desc: A British officer saves an Indian prince from an uprising and tries to escort him and the boy's nanny to safety on board a dilapidated train. However, his mission is jeopardised when it becomes clear there is a traitor on board, leading to a deadly game of cat and mouse. Action adventure, starring Lauren Bacall, Kenneth More, Herbert Lom and Wilfrid Hyde White

programme.title: Wings of Mystery (1963)
programme.desc: A group of youngsters and their prized pigeon help prevent the theft of a new alloy from a Sheffield steelworks. Children's adventure, starring Judy Geeson and Hennie Scott

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The crew of Moonbase Alpha encounters a doomed planet. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain

programme.title: Pet Island
programme.desc: The documentary meets opera singer Eugene Ginty and his miniature donkeys, and rat-breeder Laura Woods and her pets in Cork. Plus, staff at a canine creche celebrate a goldendoodle's birthday, and there's a look at the All-Ireland Cat Fancy Dress Competition in Dundalk

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert visits North Uist in the Outer Hebrides, where he goes scuba-diving to explore the underwater world of Loch nam Madadh, the largest saltwater feature of its kind on the island. Ray also admires the wildlife populating its shores, including diving and wading birds, sea eagles, red deer, otters and common seals

programme.title: The Firm (1988)
programme.desc: Disturbing drama about an estate agent named Bex who leads a double life as the head of a band of organised football thugs. Bex hatches a plan to unite the various gangs in his area and lead them on a trip to Germany to confront their Dutch hooligan rivals at the 1988 European Championship. Gary Oldman stars, with Phil Davis and Lesley Manville

programme.title: Albatross (2011)
programme.desc: Bookish teenager Beth is desperate to escape her dull home life. She finds a kindred spirit in Emelia, a troubled 17-year-old with dreams of becoming a writer, who comes to work at her parents' hotel. Emelia forms a friendship with Beth, but also has an affair with her father, which threatens to tear the family apart. Drama, with Jessica Brown Findlay, Felicity Jones, Sebastian Koch and Julia Ormond

programme.title: Telstar: The Joe Meek Story (2008)
programme.desc: Biopic of the influential 1960s record producer who became a success with a string of number-one hits, including the multi-million-selling Telstar, but was ultimately brought down by depression and paranoia as his volatile personality drove away those closest to him. With Con O'Neill, Kevin Spacey, Pam Ferris, James Corden and JJ Feild

programme.title: The Most Dangerous Ways to School
programme.desc: Children who take treacherous journeys to school, climbing up mountainous paths, swimming across rivers or fighting their way through icy wastelands

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: Arguably the deadliest single-aircraft accident in aviation history, in August 1985, when a Boeing 747 jumbo-jet suffered a fatal decompression that ripped off most of the tail

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: London cabbie Mason McQueen and Terry Wogan head to Marlow, where they are intrigued to discover the historic Buckinghamshire town boasts many food producers and restaurants. The duo are served up a dish by Michelin-starred chef Atul Kochhar, treated to a pub lunch by Tom Kerridge and after Mason has a go at rowing on the River Thames, it's time to sample the county's regional dish of Bacon Badger

Monkey is summoned to Heaven where he is imprisoned under a mound of rocks. Masoaki Sakai, Toshiyuki Nishida, Shiro Kishibe and Masako Natsume star

programme.title: A Place of One's Own (1945)
programme.desc: An ageing couple move into a haunted house, where their companion becomes possessed by the spirit of a murdered girl. Ghost story, starring James Mason, Barbara Mullen, Margaret Lockwood, Dennis Price, Dulcie Gray and Michael Shepley

programme.title: Clambake (1967)
programme.desc: A millionaire's son is determined to succeed on his own, so changes places with a poor water-skiing instructor to prove he can live without the perks of wealth. Musical, with Elvis Presley, Shelley Fabares, Bill Bixby and Will Hutchins
